thread.title: Jaap Stam could walk away from Reading following uncertainty surrounding the club’s ownership
thread.title_full: Jaap Stam could walk away from Reading following uncertainty surrounding the club’s ownership

author: gboulton
title: Jaap Stam could walk away from Reading following uncertainty surrounding the club’s ownership

persons.name: jose mourinho kante keep him away n'golo kante

text:
Comments JAAP STAM could quit Reading over uncertainty about the club’s ownership. 
The Royals’ Thai owners have been in talks with a Chinese group for three months but the takeover looks to have fallen through. PA:Press Association 4 Jaap Stam could quit Reading with uncertainty surrounding the club’s future 
Boss Stam said: “I don’t know what’s happening, I haven’t spoken about it for weeks. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Reading news, gossip and transfers on our club page 
“I don’t know what’s going to happen in the future which I think is very important for myself and for the club. 
“If you want to do something, you need to have a plan for what you eventually want to achieve. 
“You need to know what you’re going to do with the team, the staff and the structure of the club. Reuters Jaap Stam’s side are currently fifth in the Championship PA:Press Association Reading have won just one of their last five matches Related stories Liverpool and Arsenal fear being robbed of Champions League spot by Manchester United and Leicester Ron's Real nemesis Cristiano Ronaldo and a host of Real Madrid stars' futures could be under threat as Monchi comes in CAN'T KEEP CALM AND CARRA ON Hilarious moment Jamie Carragher snaps at Jamie Redknapp for interrupting his expert analysis on Sky Sports Brawl in Brazil Chaos in Brazil as local derby erupts into a mass fight between players and fans out on their own Luke Shaw, Anthony Martial and Bastian Schweinsteiger sent to train on their own by Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho Kante Keep Him Away N'Golo Kante celebrates Leicester's Champions League win over Sevilla from King Power stands 
“If it’s not clear where we are going towards the end of the season then people need to make up their minds for what they want to do.” 
Stam’s contract is up at the end of the season and although a new contract is not on his mind, the Dutchman insists he is still thinking about his future. 
The 44-year-old added: “My contract is not on my mind at the minute.I’m not thinking about contracts yet, but I’m thinking about the future – it’s very important for myself. Reuters 4 Jaap Stam’s Reading contract expires at the end of the season 
“My ambition is clear – making steps within a couple of seasons to go up to the Premier League. There needs to be a plan in getting there. 
“But is there a plan if we don’t go up, can we make changes over players or certain things and what happens then? 
“I need to think about it and if that’s what I want.” Manchester United 4-0 Reading : Wayne Rooney equals Bobby Charlton’s goal record
